proof:
Proof. Let $P := \{v \in V : \deg(v) \leq b\}$. Then, $Q := V \setminus P$. Since each vertex is in exactly one of $P$ or $Q$, this is a partition.

We by bounding $G[P]$. For every $v \in P$, $\deg(v) \leq b$ in $G$. Since $G[P]$ is a subgraph of $G$, $\deg(v) \leq b$ in $G[P]$ as well. It follows that $\Delta(G[P]) \leq b$.

Now for the bound on $|Q|$. It is known that twice the number of edges is equal to the sum of the degrees. Hence, we have
$$ 2m = \sum_{v \in V} \deg(v) \geq  \sum_{v \in V \setminus P} \deg(v) \geq \sum_{v \in Q} b = |Q| \cdot b. $$
This gives $|Q| \leq \frac{2m}{b}$.
